question_content.barrons:question: It can be inferred from the passage that classicism has which of the following characteristics?
question_content.barrons:explanation:
Choices 2 and 3.

Emphasis on formal artistic criteria is a likely characteristic of classicism. The passage talks of the formal beauty that distinguishes the classical works of Dante and Virgil. Likewise, meticulous planning of artistic works is a likely characteristic of classicism. The passage talks of the carefully planned compositions of the classicist Dante; it also tells of the structurally flawed compositions of the romantic Goethe.

Choice 1 is incorrect. Sensitivity toward emotional promptings is characteristic of romanticism; it is an unlikely characteristic of classicism.

Choice 2 by itself is incorrect. Although you are correct to infer that an emphasis on formal artistic criteria is a likely characteristic of classicism, that inference is not the only inference you can draw from the passage.

Choices 2 and 3 are correct. An emphasis on formal artistic criteria is a likely characteristic of classicism. The passage talks of the formal beauty that distinguishes the classical words of Dante and Virgil. Likewise, the meticulous planning of artistic works is a likely characteristic of classicism. The passage talks of the carefully planned composition of the classicist Dante; it also tells of the structurally flawed composition of the romantic Goethe.

Choice 3 by itself is incorrect. Although you are correct to infer that meticulous planning of artistic works is a likely characteristic of classicism, that inference is not the only inference you can draw from the passage.
